body_html:
@cpuhrsch thanks , not sure if you have done it, if you can run the same command in a for loop. In some cases, I've seen it after a fresh build from source, the test will pass a couple of times and then fail.

I just tried it also on an Ubuntu 16.04
$ uname -a
Linux pytorch 4.4.0-121-generic #145-Ubuntu SMP Fri Apr 13 13:47:16 UTC 2018 ppc64le ppc64le ppc64le GNU/Linux
$ g++ --version
g++ (Ubuntu/IBM 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.9) 5.4.0 20160609
Copyright (C) 2015 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
This is free software; see the source for copying conditions. There is NO
warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

But I was using conda python 3.6.3

And after a couple of passes , it started giving SEGV failure. In some cases I got a hang in local_wait_for_all
I had OMP_NUM_THREADS=4 but I also unset it to get more threads to run.

I had OMP_NUM_THREADS=4  but I also unset it to get more threads to run.
body:
@cpuhrsch thanks ,  not sure if you have done it,  if you can run the same command in a for loop.  In some cases, I've seen it after a fresh build from source,  the test will pass a couple of times and then fail.  

I just tried it also on an Ubuntu 16.04 
$ uname -a
Linux pytorch 4.4.0-121-generic #145-Ubuntu SMP Fri Apr 13 13:47:16 UTC 2018 ppc64le ppc64le ppc64le GNU/Linux
$ g++ --version
g++ (Ubuntu/IBM 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.9) 5.4.0 20160609
Copyright (C) 2015 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
This is free software; see the source for copying conditions.  There is NO
warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

But I was using conda python 3.6.3

And after a couple of passes ,  it started giving SEGV failure.  In some cases I got a hang in local_wait_for_all
I had OMP_NUM_THREADS=4  but I also unset it to get more threads to run.
